title: Understanding
text: When constructing a string of $$3$$ digits, each digit can be any number from $$0$$ to $$9$$. Since numbers can be repeated, each digit is independent of the others.

title: Multiplication Principle
text: Since you're constructing a string where each digit is independent and can be repeated, you should use the Multiplication Principle. The total number of possible outcomes is found by multiplying the number of choices for each digit.

title: Application
text: Since each digit has $$10$$ choices, multiply the number of choices for each digit together.
